intro: Haenselera elatior, commonly known as the slender haenselera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their showy, often red or orange flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
